菿菿菿

菿字的基本解释

菿
dào
大。
草大的样子。

菿字的汉语字典释义

[①]［dào］
［《廣韻》都導切，去号，端。］
［《廣韻》竹角切，入覺，知。］
大。

菿字的康熙字典解释

【申集上】【艸字部】　菿； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页1040第16
【唐韻】都盜切【集韻】刀號切，?音到。【說文】草木倒也。　又【集韻】覩老切，音倒。草名。　又竹角切，音斲。草大貌。　又【詩·小雅】倬彼甫田。【韓詩】作菿彼甫田。

菿字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体韩国明朝体
菿字的起名意思

暂无。

Chu
Basic explanation of words
Chu
dào
Big.
The grass is big.
Chu
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［dào］
["Guangyun" all guide cutting, go to the number, and end. ]
["Guangyun" bamboo corner cuts, enters consciousness, knows. ]
Big.
Chu
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Shen Ji 1] [Department of Jian Zi] 　菿; Kangxi strokes: 14; Page number: page 1040 to 16
[Tang Yun] All steal and cut [Ji Yun] The knife number is cut, the sound arrives. [Said the text] The vegetation is down.　[Jiyun] The old cut, the sound is inverted. Cursive name.　The bamboo horns are cut again, and the sound is not. The grass looks big.　[Poetry·Xiaoya] Zhuo Bifutian. [Han Poems] As Zhu Bifutian.
Chu
